- I wanted to share my journey and give back to a community that shaped me 💬
- Highlight diverse voices, experiences, and projects in R
- Encourage others to feel seen and inspired 💡

## 🗓️ Preparing for the Week

- Planned themed posts for each day:
  - My journey into R 📚
  - What I do + side projects 💼
  - Favorite R packages 📦
  - Lessons from the community (rainbowR, ShinyConf) 🌈
- Used Quarto to draft posts and organised content visually

---

## 🧵 Daily Threads & Engagement

- Shared how I use R in my work: data wrangling, analysis, and creating dashboards
- Discussed packages like `{tidylog}`, `{quarto}`, `{golem}`, and `{ellmer}`
- Asked the community to share their favorite R packages, projects, and workflows
- Loved seeing how others use R creatively! 💬

## ✨ Highlights from the Week

- Conversations about using R for everyday tasks like menu planning or gift selection 🎁
- Showcased my journey from student to analyst to community builder
- Talked about Shiny dashboards for LGBTQ+ film data 📽️

## 🗺️ TidyTuesday: First Treemap

::: {style="font-size: 60%;"}

- Participated in [**#TidyTuesday Week 18**](https://github.com/LucyNjokiNjuki/Tidy_Tuesday/blob/master/2025/SRC/wk_18_Science_Foundation_Grant.R) — NSF Grant Terminations under the Trump Administration
- Created my **first-ever treemap** using `{treemapify}` 📦
- Visualised grant terminations by NSF directorate and division
- Opened up a great conversation on improving clarity and accessibility in data viz
- A fun and practical way to level up my R & ggplot skills!

:::

## 🛠️ `{tidylog}` – your R co-pilot!

With `{tidylog}`, you get friendly messages that help track changes at each step of your data pipeline — great for debugging and learning!

![](Images/tidylog_post.png)
